text: I had a great time catching up with friends last night.
Great, my train was cancelled again.
I love how peaceful the morning felt.
I just love waking up late and missing everything.
The lesson finally made sense to me.
That lesson went straight over my head.
Amazing work by the whole team.
Amazing how nothing went right.
Dinner turned out really well.
Dinner was a complete disaster.
I felt calm and focused while studying.
I couldn’t focus at all.
Perfect weather for being outside.
Perfect, it started raining the moment I left.
I’m happy with the decision I made.
I regret making that decision.
The trip was relaxing and enjoyable.
The trip was exhausting and stressful.
I felt confident during the presentation.
I felt nervous and unprepared.
That joke actually made me laugh.
That joke was painfully awkward.
I’m glad I gave this a try.
I shouldn’t have bothered with this.
Everything worked out in the end.
Nothing worked out at all.
This made my day better.
This ruined my mood.
Sure, that went exactly as planned.
It actually went exactly as planned.
I enjoyed the quiet moment to myself.
I felt lonely and bored.
The explanation was clear and helpful.
The explanation only made things worse.
I’m satisfied with my progress.
I feel stuck and disappointed.
That was a pleasant surprise.
That was an unpleasant shock.
I felt supported by the people around me.
I felt completely on my own.
The plan worked perfectly.
Perfect, now we have even more problems.
I’m genuinely excited about what’s next.
I’m dreading what comes next.
The atmosphere was warm and welcoming.
The atmosphere felt tense and uncomfortable.
I handled the situation well.
I handled that situation badly.
That outcome makes me feel relieved.
That outcome makes me feel frustrated.
